00029 
00030 #if defined(__APPLE__)
00031

00038 // Based on Apple's recommended method as described in
00039 // http://developer.apple.com/qa/qa2004/qa1361.html
00040 static bool AmIBeingDebugged()
00041 // Returns true if the current process is being debugged (either
00042 // running under the debugger or has a debugger attached post facto).
00043 {
00044  // Initialize mib, which tells sysctl what info we want.  In this case,
00045  // we're looking for information about a specific process ID.
00046  int mib[] =
00047  {
00048   CTL_KERN,
00049   KERN_PROC,
00050   KERN_PROC_PID,
00051   getpid()
00052  };
00053  
00054  // Caution: struct kinfo_proc is marked __APPLE_API_UNSTABLE.  The source and
00055  // binary interfaces may change.
00056  struct kinfo_proc info;
00057  size_t info_size = sizeof ( info );
00058  
00059  int sysctl_result = sysctl ( mib, sizeof(mib) / sizeof(*mib), &info, &info_size, NULL, 0 );
00060  if ( sysctl_result != 0 )
00061   return false;
00062  
00063  // This process is being debugged if the P_TRACED flag is set.
00064  return ( info.kp_proc.p_flag & P_TRACED ) != 0;
00065 }
00066 
00067 #else
00068 
00069 #include <sys/types.h>
00070 #include <sys/stat.h>
00071 #include <fcntl.h>
00072 #include <cstring>
00073 #include <unistd.h>
00074 
00075 
00076 static bool AmIBeingDebugged() {
00077  // We can look in /proc/self/status for TracerPid.  We are likely used in crash
00078  // handling, so we are careful not to use the heap or have side effects.
00079  int status_fd = open("/proc/self/status", O_RDONLY);
00080  if (status_fd == -1)
00081   return false;
00082  
00083  // We assume our line will be in the first 1024 characters and that we can
00084  // read this much all at once.  In practice this will generally be true.
00085  // This simplifies and speeds up things considerably.
00086  char buf[1024];
00087  
00088  ssize_t num_read = read(status_fd, buf, sizeof(buf));
00089  fix_markend(buf);
00090  close(status_fd);
00091  if (num_read <= 0) return false;
00092  
00093  const char* searchStr = "TracerPid:\t";
00094  const char* f = strstr(buf, searchStr);
00095  if(f == NULL) return false;
00096  
00097  // Our pid is 0 without a debugger, assume this for any pid starting with 0.
00098  f += strlen(searchStr);
00099  return f < &buf[num_read] && *f != '0';
00100 }
00101 
00102 #endif // OSX/LINUX

00104 #include <signal.h>
00105 
00106 void RaiseDebugger() {
00107  if(AmIBeingDebugged()) {
00108   printf("I am being debugged, raising debugger ...\n");
00109   CrashHandler::get()->disable();
00110   // TODO: We need a way to set another ucontext here. (And that should be specified via a parameter
00111   // to RaiseDebugger().) E.g. when we use this function in the debugger thread, we want to set the
00112   // ucontext of the main loop thread.
00113   raise(SIGABRT);
00114   CrashHandler::get()->enable();
00115  } else
00116   printf("I am not being debugged, ignoring debugger raise.\n");
00117 }

00353 #ifndef GCOREDUMPER
00354 static void GdbWriteCoreDump(const char* fname) {
00355  // WARNING: this is terribly slow like this
00356  char gdbparam[1000];
00357  sprintf(gdbparam,
00358    "attach %i \n"
00359    "gcore %s \n"
00360    "detach \n"
00361    "quit \n",
00362    getpid(), fname);
00363  FILE* p = popen("gdb -q", "w");
00364  if(p) {
00365   fprintf(p, "%s", gdbparam);
00366   fflush(p);
00367   //int status = 0; wait(&status);
00368   pclose(p);
00369  }
00370 }
00371 #endif
00372 
00373 void OlxWriteCoreDump(const char* file_postfix) {
00374  char corefile[PATH_MAX + 100];
00375  if(getcwd(corefile, PATH_MAX) == NULL) strcpy(corefile, "");
00376  strcat(corefile, "/core.OpenLieroX");
00377  if(file_postfix) { strcat(corefile, "."); strcat(corefile, file_postfix); }
00378  printf("writing coredump to %s\n", corefile);
00379  
00380  printf("dumping core ... "); fflush(0);
00381 #ifdef GCOREDUMPER
00382  WriteCoreDump(corefile);
00383 #else
00384  GdbWriteCoreDump(corefile);
00385 #endif
00386  printf("ready\n");
00387 }

00416 void DumpCallstackPrintf(void* callpnt) {
00417  void *callstack[128];
00418  int framesC = backtrace(callstack, sizeof(callstack));
00419  printf("backtrace() returned %d addresses\n", framesC);
00420  if(callpnt != NULL && framesC > 3) callstack[3] = callpnt; // expected to be called from signal handler
00421  char** strs = backtrace_symbols(callstack, framesC);
00422  for(int i = 0; i < framesC; ++i) {
00423   if(strs[i])
00424    printf("%s\n", strs[i]);
00425   else
00426    break;
00427  }
00428  free(strs);
00429 }
00430 
00431 void DumpCallstack(void (*PrintOutFct) (const std::string&)) {
00432  void *callstack[128];
00433  int framesC = backtrace(callstack, sizeof(callstack));
00434  (*PrintOutFct) ("DumpCallstack: " + itoa(framesC) + " addresses:");
00435  char** strs = backtrace_symbols(callstack, framesC);
00436  for(int i = 0; i < framesC; ++i) {
00437   if(strs[i])
00438    (*PrintOutFct) (std::string(" ") + strs[i] + "\n");
00439   else
00440    break;
00441  }
00442  free(strs);
00443 }
00444

00499 std::string GetLogTimeStamp()
00500 {
00501  // TODO: please recode this, don't use C-strings!
00502  char buf[64];
00503  const time_t unif_time = time(NULL);
00504  struct tm *t = localtime(&unif_time);
00505  if (t == NULL)
00506   return "";
00507  
00508  strftime(buf, sizeof(buf), "[%H:%M:%S] ", t);
00509  fix_markend(buf);
00510  return std::string(buf);
00511 }

00522 
00523 static SDL_mutex* globalCoutMutex = NULL;
00524 
00525 Logger::Logger(int o, int ingame, int callst, const std::string& p)
00526 : minCoutVerb(o), minIngameConVerb(ingame), minCallstackVerb(callst), prefix(p), lastWasNewline(true), mutex(NULL) {
00527  mutex = SDL_CreateMutex();
00528  if(!globalCoutMutex)
00529   globalCoutMutex = SDL_CreateMutex();
00530 }
00531 
00532 Logger::~Logger() {
00533  SDL_DestroyMutex(mutex); mutex = NULL;
00534  if(globalCoutMutex) {
00535   SDL_DestroyMutex(globalCoutMutex);
00536   globalCoutMutex = NULL;
00537  }
00538 }
00539 
00540 void Logger::lock() {
00541  SDL_mutexP(mutex);
00542 }
00543 
00544 void Logger::unlock() {
00545  SDL_mutexV(mutex);
00546 }
00547 
00548 static void CoutPrint(const std::string& str) {
00549  // TODO: We have used std::cout here before but it doesn't seem to work after a while for some reason.
00550  printf("%s", str.c_str());
00551 }
00552 
00553 int Logger_Verbosity = 0;
00554 
00555 // true if last was newline
00556 static bool logger_output(Logger& log, const std::string& buf) {
00557  bool ret = true;
00558  
00559  std::string prefix = log.prefix;
00560  
00561  if(Logger_Verbosity >= log.minCoutVerb) {
00562   SDL_mutexP(globalCoutMutex);
00563   ret = PrettyPrint(prefix, buf, CoutPrint, log.lastWasNewline);
00564   //std::cout.flush();
00565   SDL_mutexV(globalCoutMutex);
00566  }
00567  if(Logger_Verbosity >= log.minCallstackVerb) {
00568   DumpCallstackPrintf();
00569   // TODO: Check whether that call with NULL is correct
00570  }
00571  return ret;
00572 }
00573 
00574 Logger& Logger::flush() {
00575  lock();
00576  lastWasNewline = logger_output(*this, buffer);
00577  buffer = "";
00578  unlock();
00579  return *this;
00580 }
